titleStmt.title: S. W. Brown et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9840

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his Exl. B, Magoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioners the undersigned would most respectfully state that ^at^ the term of the Rockcastle Circuit Court Ben, R, P, Langford was indicted for an alledged offense of shooting at one A. J. Mershon maliciously with intent to Kill without hiting or wounding him, and the case has been pending in said court ever since and one trial had which resulted in a hung Jury, and not desiring to see said Langford further harrassed and annoyed by said indictment, said Mershon being a notorious bad character now in view of all circumstances we humbly ask your Excellency to pardon the offense

S. W. Brown
Uriah Albright
Jo. E. Smith D clk R. c. c.
M C Miller C R C
D G Colyer clk
